title: Dunkirk
summary: Dunkirk (UK: /dʌnˈkɜːk/ dun-KURK, US: /ˈdʌnkɜːrk/ DUN-kurk;[3][4] French: Dunkerque [dæ̃kɛʁk] (listen); French Flemish: Duunkerke; Dutch: Duinkerke(n) [ˈdœy̯ŋkɛrkə(n)] (listen)) is a commune in Nord, a French department in northern France. It lies 10 kilometres (6.2 mi) from the Belgian border. It has the third-largest French harbour. The population of the commune at the 2016 census was 91,412.
